questions.skill_area: Describe Azure compute and networking services
questions.question: List and briefly describe three scenarios where you would use Azure Container Instances instead of Azure Virtual Machines.
questions.purpose: Test understanding of container vs VM use cases.
scoring_criteria: Identifies at least three scenarios for using ACI (e.g., batch jobs, development/testing, microservices).
For each scenario, provides relevant details explaining why ACI is better than VMs.
Mentions at least one benefit of ACI (e.g., no OS management, fast startup, cost-efficiency).

questions.skill_area: Describe Azure compute and networking services
questions.question: Explain the management differences between Azure Virtual Machines and Azure Container Instances.
scoring_criteria: Describes that VMs require OS patching, updates, and configuration.
Describes that ACI abstracts OS and infrastructure management.
Mentions differences in scaling and maintenance.

questions.skill_area: Describe Azure compute and networking services
questions.question: Compare the ideal use cases for Azure Virtual Machines and Azure Container Instances.
questions.purpose: Assess ability to match workloads to the correct Azure compute option.
scoring_criteria: Correctly matches persistent, stateful workloads to VMs.
Identifies quick, short-lived, or burst workloads as ideal for ACI.
Discusses at least one example for each.

questions.skill_area: Describe Azure compute and networking services
questions.question: Describe how Azure Container Instances can benefit DevOps teams.
questions.purpose: Assess knowledge of ACI in modern application development.
scoring_criteria: Mentions rapid provisioning or scaling for CI/CD pipelines.
Highlights simplified environment setup (no VM management needed).
Describes integration with other Azure services (e.g., Logic Apps, Functions).

questions.question: Can Azure Cost Management set up alerts when spending exceeds a defined budget?
Does the Azure Pricing Calculator provide real-time alerts on actual spending?
Can you export Azure Pricing Calculator estimates to share with stakeholders?
Is Azure Cost Management only available for Enterprise Agreement customers?
Outline the steps to use Azure Cost Management to monitor and optimize cloud spending.
questions.purpose: Assess knowledge of Azure cost monitoring and optimization workflow.
scoring_criteria: Describes reviewing cost analysis and actual usage.
Explains setting up budgets and alerts.
Mentions identifying cost optimization opportunities (e.g., reserved instances, right sizing).
Refers to exporting or sharing reports.

questions.question: Explain the difference between the Azure Pricing Calculator and Azure Cost Management.
questions.purpose: Evaluate understanding of Azure cost estimation versus monitoring.
scoring_criteria: Identifies Pricing Calculator as a pre-deployment estimation tool.
Describes Cost Management as tracking and analyzing actual spend.
Mentions how both are used together for planning and ongoing management.

questions.question: Describe how setting up budgets in Azure Cost Management can help an organization.
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of budget features and business impact.
scoring_criteria: Explains how budgets enable proactive cost control.
Mentions email or service alerts when thresholds are reached.
Describes impact on financial planning.

questions.question: Provide two examples of actions you can take if Azure Cost Management shows your spending is higher than expected.
questions.purpose: Evaluate knowledge of corrective cost actions.
scoring_criteria: Lists at least two appropriate actions (e.g., review resource usage, delete unused resources, switch to reserved instances, adjust scaling).
Briefly explains each action.
